edu.first.util

Class Strings

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.first.util.Strings

  • public class Strings
extends java.lang.Object
    A set of utility methods to manipulate and test strings. Contains many of the methods that String is missing in Java ME.
    Since:
    May 14 13

      • split

        public static java.lang.String[] split(java.lang.String string,
                       java.lang.String split)
        Splits the string into separate parts that happen in between the split.

        Ex. spilt("Hello world, my name is Tim.", ",") Would return ["Hello World", " my name is Tim."]

        Parameters:
        string - original string to split
        split - spliting artifact in the string
        Returns:
        parts of the string in between the splits
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - when split is null

      • split

                       char split)
        Splits the string into separate parts that happen in between the split.

        Ex. spilt("Hello world, my name is Tim.", ',') Would return ["Hello World", " my name is Tim."]

        Parameters:

        split - spliting character in the string

        parts of the string in between the splits

      • replace

        public static java.lang.String replace(java.lang.String string,
                       java.lang.String replace,
                       java.lang.String replacement)
        Replaces the selected section with the replacement.

        Ex: replace("ABC", "B", "D") returns "ADC".

        Parameters:
        string - main string to do replacement on
        replace - what section to replace
        replacement - the replacement for the section
        Returns:
        string with replace replaced with replacement
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - when replace string or replacement string are null

      • replaceAll

        public static java.lang.String replaceAll(java.lang.String string,
                          java.lang.String replace,
                          java.lang.String replacement)
        Replaces all instances of replace with replacement.

        Ex: replaceAll("ABCABC", "B", "D") returns "ADCADC".

        Parameters:
        string - main string to do replacement on
        replace - what section to replace
        replacement - the replacement for the section
        Returns:
        string with all instances of replace replaced with replacement
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - when replace string or replacement string are null
